Phd Institutes in India

Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Bombay, India:

Centre for Studies in Resources Engineering

The Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) Bombay, situated in Mumbai, India, is a premier institution renowned for its world-class education, cutting-edge research, and technological innovation. Established in 1958, IIT Bombay has grown into one of the leading engineering and technology institutes globally.
Offers a Ph.D. program with a focus on remote sensing applications in natural resources.
To know more

Phd Institutes(International).

University of Maryland, College Park (USA):

Department of Geographical Sciences

The University of Maryland, College Park (UMD), commonly referred to as UMD or Maryland, is a public research university located in College Park, Maryland, USA.
Offers a Ph.D. program with research opportunities in remote sensing and related areas.
To know more

University of Zurich (Switzerland):

Department of Geography

The University of Zurich (UZH), established in 1833, stands as one of Switzerland's oldest and most esteemed institutions of higher learning.
Provides a Ph.D. program in Geography with a focus on remote sensing and geoinformation.
To know more

University of Twente (Netherlands):

Faculty of Geo-Information Science and Earth Observation (ITC)

The University of Twente, located in Enschede, Netherlands, is renowned for its commitment to fostering innovation, technology, and multidisciplinary research. Established in 1961, the university has since evolved into a hub for cutting-edge education and impactful research.
Offers a Ph.D. program in Geo-Information Science and Earth Observation, encompassing remote sensing.
To know more

University of Tokyo (Japan):

{" "} Graduate School of Frontier Sciences

The University of Tokyo, often referred to as Todai, stands as Japan's premier institution of higher learning, recognized globally for its academic excellence and groundbreaking research. Established in 1877, the university has played a pivotal role in shaping Japan's intellectual landscape and remains a symbol of academic prestige.
Provides Ph.D. programs related to Earth and Environmental Sciences, including research in remote sensing.
To know more

Technical University of Munich (Germany):

Department of Aerospace and Geodesy

The Technical University of Munich (TUM), situated in Munich, Germany, is a prestigious institution recognized for its emphasis on science, engineering, and technology. Established in 1868,
Offers a Ph.D. program in Geodesy and Geoinformation, with research opportunities in remote sensing.
To know more

University of Southampton (United Kingdom):

Geography and Environmental Science

The University of Southampton, situated in the United Kingdom, is a distinguished institution celebrated for its commitment to education, research, and innovation. Established in 1862 as the Hartley Institution, it has grown into a leading global university known for its academic excellence and contributions to various fields.
Provides a Ph.D. program with opportunities for research in remote sensing and geospatial analysis.
To know more
